title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-debt-tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML designed to help users track and visualize their sleep debt. It allows users to input their sleep schedule and desired sleep duration, calculating and displaying accumulated sleep debt over time. This project serves as a practical application of TypeScript and aims to provide a simple and intuitive interface for managing sleep habits.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project showcasing interactive map visualizations created using HTML for the front-end interface and Python for data processing and generation. This repository contains the code for building dynamic maps, potentially leveraging libraries to display geographical data and insights effectively. The project focuses on demonstrating data visualization techniques within a geographical context.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python, Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, designed as a project to demonstrate proficiency in developing web applications. It leverages Flask for backend logic, PostgreSQL for data persistence, and a combination of HTML and CSS for a user-friendly frontend, showcasing a comprehensive understanding of building and deploying interactive web applications.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository houses a web application built with JavaScript, Python (likely for backend or scripting), HTML, and CSS, designed to provide a user interface and visualization tools for the Robofleet robotics platform. It likely focuses on displaying and interacting with robot data, control panels, or other elements relevant to managing and monitoring a fleet of robots, aligning with the general "project" topic.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript to create a fully functional and responsive admin dashboard. This repository showcases modern web development practices with Next.js, focusing on clean code architecture and dynamic data rendering to provide users with an intuitive and efficient interface for managing and visualizing key metrics. It serves as a learning resource and a foundation for building custom dashboards for various applications.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built using TypeScript and JavaScript focused on [Assume based on common project types: modern web application development/data visualization/command-line tooling/etc.]. This repository showcases [Mention key features or project goals, e.g., efficient data handling, interactive user interfaces, robust CLI execution] and explores best practices in [Mention relevant topics, e.g., state management, asynchronous programming, cross-platform compatibility], serving as a practical example of modern web development techniques.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack web application built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI), designed as a project management dashboard. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and state management, providing a robust and scalable foundation for building modern web applications with a focus on clean code and best practices within a TypeScript environment.

title: next-voting
description: Next-Voting is a web application built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to provide a modern and efficient platform for creating and participating in various voting events. Leveraging Next.js for its performant rendering and routing capabilities, this project aims to streamline the voting process with a user-friendly interface and robust backend logic, focusing on clear presentation and a smooth user experience for all participants.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing log files generated by Robot Operating System (ROS) applications. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripts, this project provides an intuitive interface to filter, search, and display ROS log data, aiding in debugging and performance analysis of robotics systems. It's a valuable project for anyone working with ROS seeking to improve their log management and diagnostic capabilities.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack project built with TypeScript, Vite.js, Express.js, and styled with CSS, leveraging the Gemini API to provide insightful conversational AI interactions. This repository showcases a modern web application architecture, demonstrating effective integration of a large language model with a robust backend and dynamic frontend, exploring key technologies within the expressjs and typescript ecosystems.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next Idea Board is a collaborative project management tool built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to help teams brainstorm, organize, and prioritize project ideas. Featuring a clean and intuitive interface, the board allows users to easily add new ideas, categorize them with labels, and vote on their favorites, streamlining the initial project development phase and fostering a more collaborative and efficient workflow.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository hosts a collection of finance-related projects implemented in Python using Jupyter Notebooks. It explores various financial concepts and techniques, leveraging Python libraries for data analysis, visualization, and potentially modeling, providing practical examples and applications within the realm of finance.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the LaTeX source code for my resume, along with an HTML version generated from it. It serves as a project demonstrating my skills in typesetting and web development, showcasing a clean and professional representation of my experience and qualifications. This project is intended for personal use and serves as a template for creating and maintaining a digital resume.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-Event-Calendar is a JavaScript, CSS, and HTML-based project focused on creating a customizable and interactive event calendar. This repository provides a foundation for building a dynamic calendar that can display and manage events, offering a user-friendly interface for scheduling and viewing activities. It leverages front-end web technologies to provide a responsive and engaging experience, making it a versatile project for learning and implementing event management features within web applications.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository houses a modern, full-stack web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, TailwindCSS, and Supabase for tracking IoT assets. It leverages these technologies to provide a user-friendly interface for monitoring the location and status of connected devices, demonstrating a practical project implementation of IoT asset management concepts.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a comprehensive e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and JavaScript, showcasing best practices for modern web development. This repository leverages Material-UI (MUI) for a responsive and visually appealing user interface, and utilizes React Query for efficient data fetching and caching. Designed as a practical learning resource, Fruit-Seller demonstrates a complete shopping experience with a focus on type safety and maintainability within an e-commerce context.
